intro: Lithospermum secundiflorum, commonly known as red root, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant produces a red, fleshy root that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is commonly found in open woodlands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and herbal applications.
